p.k: Earl Hines and his group, consisting of Rudy Rutherford (reeds), Jimmy Leary (bass), and Eddie Graham (drums) perform in Spa in 1977. Singer Marva Josie joins the group for two songs before the set closes with an exhilarating version of "Caravan."
p.d: Despite his advanced age, the legendary jazz pianist Earl Hines was at the top of his game when he performed in the Belgian town of Spa in 1977. With a band consisting of Rudy Rutherford (reeds), Jimmy Leary (bass), and Eddie Graham (drums), Hines livens up the room with his interpretations of "I Can't Believe That You're In Love With Me" and "The Man I Love." Marva Josie joins the group for soulful renditions of "A Sunday Kind of Love" and the well-known classic "Kansas City" before the set comes to a close with "Caravan," which features a lengthy drum solo by Graham.
